intro: Sutera canescens var. laevior, commonly known as the smooth sutera, is a variant of the sutera canescens species native to certain regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family, characterized by its woolly or hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and stamens arranged in a showy display. This plant thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in coastal or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for horticultural and ecological studies.
